body:
Thanks for the report. It should be a simple fix in callmap files: https://github.com/vimeo/psalm/tree/master/dictionaries

Care to push a PR?
yep, I'll give it a try !

issue.title: ReflectionClass::getReflectionConstants has a filter parameter

labels.name: release:feature
labels.description: The PR will be included in 'Features' section of the release notes

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body:
It was introduced in php 8.0.

Fixes #6588

body: It seems that [`ReflectionClassConstant`](https://www.php.net/manual/en/class.reflectionclassconstant.php#reflectionclassconstant.constants.modifiers) constants are not known either. I would be happy to PR that too but I didn't find were this can be done, could you guide me ?
You'll have to create a stub for that in CoreGenericClasses.phpstub. It's a class shell that Psalm use to know everything about its types

Actually, I'm wondering if it's an actual bug or not because I don't get it on my code base with php 8.0 runtime however when playing with psalm playground the errors are raised:
https://psalm.dev/r/1f4b49a27c

I found these snippets:
<details>
<summary>https://psalm.dev/r/1f4b49a27c</summary>

```php
<?php

echo \ReflectionClassConstant::IS_PUBLIC;
echo \ReflectionClassConstant::IS_PRIVATE;
echo \ReflectionClassConstant::IS_PROTECTED;
```

```
Psalm output (using commit 1a2ac65):

ERROR: UndefinedConstant - 3:6 - Constant ReflectionClassConstant::IS_PUBLIC is not defined

INFO: MixedArgument - 3:6 - Argument 1 of echo cannot be mixed, expecting string

ERROR: UndefinedConstant - 4:6 - Constant ReflectionClassConstant::IS_PRIVATE is not defined

INFO: MixedArgument - 4:6 - Argument 1 of echo cannot be mixed, expecting string

ERROR: UndefinedConstant - 5:6 - Constant ReflectionClassConstant::IS_PROTECTED is not defined

INFO: MixedArgument - 5:6 - Argument 1 of echo cannot be mixed, expecting string
```
</details>
Not sure why you wouldn't get errors on your code. Are you sure those aren't suppressed or baselined?

I maybe missed something. Here is the test sample I got: https://github.com/vaceletm/psalm/commit/d9768d367fd644a92116a13e4466dc6892824e46

```
[mvacelet:~/workspace/psalm] reflection-class-constants(+0/-0,1)+ ±  ./vendor/bin/phpunit --configuration phpunit.xml.dist tests/ReflectionClassConstantsTest.php 
PHPUnit 9.5.10 by Sebastian Bergmann and contributors.

Runtime:       PHP 7.4.24
Configuration: phpunit.xml.dist
Random Seed:   1633442687

E                                                                   1 / 1 (100%)

Time: 00:00.764, Memory: 36.00 MB

There was 1 error:

1) Psalm\Tests\ReflectionClassConstantsTest::testValidCode with data set #0 ('<?php\n                echo R...      ', array(), array(), '8.0')
Psalm\Exception\CodeException: UndefinedConstant - src/somefile.php:2:22 - Constant ReflectionClassConstant::IS_PUBLIC is not defined

/home/mvacelet/workspace/psalm/src/Psalm/IssueBuffer.php:263
/home/mvacelet/workspace/psalm/src/Psalm/IssueBuffer.php:113
/home/mvacelet/workspace/psalm/src/Psalm/Internal/Analyzer/Statements/Expression/Fetch/ClassConstFetchAnalyzer.php:286
/home/mvacelet/workspace/psalm/src/Psalm/Internal/Analyzer/Statements/ExpressionAnalyzer.php:205
/home/mvacelet/workspace/psalm/src/Psalm/Internal/Analyzer/Statements/ExpressionAnalyzer.php:43
/home/mvacelet/workspace/psalm/src/Psalm/Internal/Analyzer/Statements/EchoAnalyzer.php:35
/home/mvacelet/workspace/psalm/src/Psalm/Internal/Analyzer/StatementsAnalyzer.php:532
/home/mvacelet/workspace/psalm/src/Psalm/Internal/Analyzer/StatementsAnalyzer.php:186
/home/mvacelet/workspace/psalm/src/Psalm/Internal/Analyzer/FileAnalyzer.php:190
/home/mvacelet/workspace/psalm/tests/TestCase.php:134
/home/mvacelet/workspace/psalm/tests/Traits/ValidCodeAnalysisTestTrait.php:87

ERRORS!
Tests: 1, Assertions: 0, Errors: 1.
[mvacelet:~/workspace/psalm] reflection-class-constants(+1/-1,1)+ 2 ± php80 ./vendor/bin/phpunit --configuration phpunit.xml.dist tests/ReflectionClassConstantsTest.php 
PHPUnit 9.5.10 by Sebastian Bergmann and contributors.

Runtime:       PHP 8.0.11
Configuration: phpunit.xml.dist
Random Seed:   1633442693

.                                                                   1 / 1 (100%)

Time: 00:00.501, Memory: 26.00 MB

OK (1 test, 1 assertion)
```
I guess that the test pass because in php 8.0 the constant is defined so no need for the stub.

indeed. I'm not too worried about that though. It would mean someone uses PHP 7.4 to run psalm with --php-version=8.0 to analyze code made for 8.0.

But you're welcome to create the stub anyway :) Probably in PHP80.phpstub insted of CoreGenericClasses.phpstub
